page.title: 07Pentre Maelor Housing
page.content: With the development of post-war light industry, buildings erected in 1940 as part of the Royal Ordnance Factory were adapted for housing. The Board of Trade built 100 houses for rent in 1947 to attract key workers at a time of manpower shortage. In the 1960's they were bought by Wrexham Rural District Council. They are of traditional brick with tiled rooves, cement rendered walls and colour washed. There are detached, four-bedroomed houses and smaller ones grouped together in blocks. The houses, with their small paned metal window frames, are very well maintained with attractive flower beds and well-cut open grass areas. One part is called "Pilgrim's Way" - a reference to a nearby pilgrim's grave on an old route of the Middle Ages.
